intro: Pleurothallis circinata, commonly known as the spiral orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and often white or pale green, with a delicate, fragrant scent. Pleurothallis circinata is appreciated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
